member.name: T:MaszynaPi.MachineLogic.IODevices.MatrixLED
member.summary:
Implementaion of representing 8x8 LED Matrix on . Provides functionality for to write data that will be shown on module's matrix, base on selected :
allows to represent passed number as one of printable ASCII symbols on Matrix
allows to paint single pixel at time, using bottom 6 bits of passed number as matrix pixel address (consecutive numbers from top-left to bottom-right). Color of each pixel is selected using 9th, 10th and 11th bit as [R,G,B] component set to 255 or 0.

member.name: T:MaszynaPi.MachineLogic.CentralProcessingUnit
member.summary:
Main monolith class, representing microcomputer's processing unit with its connections to other components such as memory or IO devices. Contain set of internal , responsible for preserving state of machine between clock cycles. Class allows to manage executing instructions by controlling internal components of the machine.
Note: The abbreviations for component and signal names are partly abbreviations from Polish, in homage to the original naming of the architecture parts of this microcomputer. The English expansion can be found in the comments.

member.name: M:MaszynaPi.MachineLogic.CentralProcessingUnit.ExecuteProgram
member.summary:
Executes all program instrucitons from current instruction register address to first instruction with opcode 0. Disables connected actions until end of program execution, due to performace issues, related to displaing CPU state in user interface.
On any error, raises with informations about currently executed instruction address, as well as active signals.

member.name: T:MaszynaPi.MachineAssembler.Assembler
member.summary:
Class responsible for compilation - changing the string from the Code Editor to a form understandable for the machine. In this case, list of numbers as (opcode shifted left by addressBits bitwaise anded with argument)
Compiler uses the static class InstructionSetDecoder - instructions opcodes are identified by searching for them in the opcode map (Dictionary InstructionNames) The code is stored in two versions:
1. Loaded as numbers into memory [List of uints]
2. Translated into a sequence of signals [List of Lists of strings][OLD - UNUSED]
